prompt: Create a hypertrophy program for someone who can train 4 days a week

rubric.rep_range_appropriate: Most working sets are 8-15 reps (hypertrophy range)
rubric.has_compound_movements: Each day includes at least one compound lift
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real, recognized movements

prompt: Build a 3-day full body beginner strength program

rubric.beginner_appropriate: Exercises are suitable for beginners (no advanced movements)
rubric.has_compound_movements: Each day includes compound movements like squat, bench, deadlift
rubric.volume_appropriate: 3-4 exercises per session, not overwhelming for beginners
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real, recognized movements

prompt: Design a push/pull/legs split for intermediate lifters

rubric.correct_split: Has distinct push, pull, and legs days
rubric.exercise_placement: Push exercises on push day, pull on pull, legs on legs
rubric.rep_range_varied: Mix of rep ranges (5-8 for compounds, 8-15 for isolation)
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real, recognized movements

prompt: Make a 5x5 strength program focused on the big three lifts

rubric.has_big_three: Includes squat, bench press, and deadlift
rubric.correct_scheme: Main lifts use 5 sets of 5 reps
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real, recognized movements

prompt: Create a bodyweight-only workout I can do while traveling with no equipment

rubric.no_equipment: No exercises require gym equipment or weights
rubric.full_body: Covers upper body, lower body, and core
rubric.practical: Exercises can be done in a hotel room or small space
rubric.has_structure: Has clear sets, reps, and rest periods
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real bodyweight movements

prompt: Build a 6-week progressive overload program for bench press

rubric.has_progression: Clear weekly weight or volume progression
rubric.bench_focused: Bench press is the primary movement
rubric.has_accessory: Includes supporting exercises for chest, shoulders, triceps
rubric.periodization: Some form of periodization (linear, undulating, etc.)
rubric.realistic_progression: Weight increases are realistic (2.5-5 lbs per week)

prompt: Design a HIIT workout that takes exactly 20 minutes

rubric.correct_duration: Total workout time is approximately 20 minutes
rubric.has_warmup: Includes warmup or mentions warming up

prompt: Create a workout for someone recovering from a knee injury, focusing on upper body

rubric.no_knee_stress: No exercises that load the knees (no squats, lunges, running)
rubric.upper_body_focus: All exercises target upper body muscles
rubric.safety_note: Mentions consulting a doctor or physical therapist
rubric.has_structure: Has clear sets, reps, and rest periods

prompt: Make a dumbbell-only home workout for building muscle, 3 days per week

rubric.dumbbells_only: All exercises can be done with dumbbells only
rubric.hypertrophy_focused: Rep ranges support muscle building (8-15 reps)
rubric.balanced: Covers all major muscle groups across the week

prompt: Design a workout for a 60-year-old who wants to stay active and maintain bone density

rubric.age_appropriate: Exercises are safe and appropriate for older adults
rubric.bone_density: Includes weight-bearing or resistance exercises for bone health
rubric.safety_note: Mentions starting slowly or consulting a doctor

prompt: Create an athletic performance program for a soccer player in the off-season

rubric.sport_specific: Includes exercises relevant to soccer (agility, endurance, leg strength)

prompt: Build a powerlifting program for someone who wants to compete in 12 weeks

rubric.has_big_three: Includes squat, bench press, and deadlift as primary lifts
rubric.meet_prep: Includes a taper/peak week near the end
rubric.rep_ranges: Uses appropriate powerlifting rep ranges (1-5 for main lifts)

prompt: Design a circuit training workout for fat loss with minimal rest

rubric.circuit_format: Exercises flow in a circuit with minimal rest between them
rubric.metabolic: High metabolic demand (compound movements, cardio elements)
rubric.has_structure: Clear number of rounds, reps, and rest periods

prompt: Create a morning mobility routine that takes 15 minutes

rubric.mobility_focused: Exercises improve joint mobility and flexibility
rubric.full_body: Covers major joints (hips, shoulders, spine, ankles)
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real movements or stretches

prompt: Make a superset workout for arms (biceps and triceps)

rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real arm exercises

prompt: Build a calisthenics progression program from beginner to muscle-up

rubric.progressive: Clear progression from basic to advanced movements
rubric.realistic_timeline: Progression timeline is realistic (months, not days)

prompt: Create a pre-natal workout safe for the second trimester

rubric.pregnancy_safe: No exercises contraindicated during pregnancy (no lying flat on back, no contact risk)
rubric.safety_note: Mentions consulting OB-GYN or healthcare provider

prompt: Design a CrossFit-style WOD (workout of the day)

rubric.crossfit_format: Uses CrossFit format (AMRAP, EMOM, For Time, etc.)
rubric.has_time_element: Has a time cap or time-based structure
rubric.scalable: Mentions scaling options or Rx weights
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real CrossFit movements

prompt: Make a shoulder rehab program with resistance bands

rubric.shoulder_focused: Targets rotator cuff and shoulder stabilizers
rubric.rehab_appropriate: Low intensity, high rep, controlled movements
rubric.progressive: Has some form of progression (harder bands, more reps)

prompt: Create a deadlift specialization program to increase my max

rubric.has_accessory: Includes accessory work for posterior chain
rubric.progressive_overload: Clear progression scheme for building toward a max

prompt: Build a workout for someone with limited time - max 30 minutes, 5 days a week

rubric.correct_duration: Each session is approximately 30 minutes or less
rubric.efficient: Uses supersets, circuits, or compound movements for time efficiency
rubric.balanced: Covers all major muscle groups across the week

prompt: Design a hypertrophy back workout with at least 5 exercises

rubric.back_focused: All exercises primarily target back muscles
rubric.movement_variety: Mix of vertical and horizontal pulling
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real back exercises

prompt: Create a plyometric workout for vertical jump improvement

rubric.jump_specific: Includes exercises that develop vertical jump
rubric.progressive: Orders exercises appropriately (complex to simple or vice versa)
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real plyometric movements

prompt: Make a marathon training plan for a beginner aiming to finish their first marathon

rubric.has_long_runs: Includes weekly long runs that increase over time
rubric.taper: Includes a taper period before race day

prompt: Build a chest and triceps workout using only barbell and bench

rubric.has_structure: Clear sets, reps, and rest periods
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are doable with just barbell and bench

prompt: Create a swim workout for improving endurance, 1 hour session
Design a German Volume Training program for mass

rubric.limited_exercises: 2-3 exercises per session (GVT is already high volume)

prompt: Make a functional fitness program for a firefighter

rubric.job_specific: Includes movements relevant to firefighting (carry, climb, pull)
rubric.strength: Has strength component for heavy lifting/carrying
rubric.practical: Exercises translate to real-world job demands

prompt: Create a workout split for someone training 6 days a week

rubric.balanced: All major muscle groups trained at least twice per week
rubric.recovery: Has some logic for recovery (not same muscle group on consecutive days)

prompt: Build an Olympic weightlifting program focusing on clean and jerk

rubric.has_clean_and_jerk: Clean and jerk is the primary focus
rubric.has_variations: Includes clean and jerk variations or components (power clean, front squat, push press)
rubric.skill_work: Includes technique/skill work at lighter weights
rubric.strength_base: Includes back squat and front squat for base strength
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real Olympic lifting movements

prompt: Design a kickboxing conditioning workout

rubric.kickboxing_elements: Includes punching and kicking combinations or drills
rubric.has_structure: Clear rounds, rest periods, or circuit format
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real kickboxing or conditioning movements

prompt: Create a core strengthening program for someone with lower back pain

rubric.back_safe: Avoids exercises that stress the lower back (no sit-ups, heavy deadlifts)

prompt: Make a workout routine using only kettlebells

rubric.has_structure: Clear sets, reps, and rest periods
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real kettlebell movements

prompt: Build a workout for improving posture, focusing on upper back and shoulders

rubric.posture_relevant: Exercises address common posture issues (rounded shoulders, forward head)
rubric.upper_back: Targets rhomboids, lower traps, rear delts
rubric.stretching_included: Includes stretches for tight muscles (chest, front delts)
rubric.not_heavy: Moderate intensity, focus on form and activation

prompt: Create a 2-day per week maintenance program for someone who is very busy

rubric.full_body: Each session is full-body to maximize limited time
rubric.compound_focused: Focuses on compound movements for efficiency
rubric.maintenance_level: Volume is appropriate for maintenance, not aggressive growth

prompt: Design a leg workout that avoids squats due to hip impingement

rubric.no_squats: Does not include back squats or front squats
rubric.leg_focused: Targets quads, hamstrings, glutes, and calves
rubric.hip_safe: Avoids deep hip flexion that aggravates impingement
rubric.alternatives: Uses squat alternatives (leg press, lunges at limited depth, etc.)

prompt: Make a high-frequency squat program, squatting every day for 4 weeks

rubric.daily_squats: Includes squatting every day (or at least 5-6 days)
rubric.intensity_variation: Varies intensity across the week (heavy, light, medium)
rubric.autoregulation: Mentions RPE, percentage-based loading, or autoregulation
rubric.realistic: Manages fatigue appropriately for daily squatting

prompt: Create a rowing machine interval workout for 25 minutes

rubric.has_metrics: Includes target pace, stroke rate, or watts
rubric.has_structure: Clear warmup, main set, and cooldown

prompt: Build a hypertrophy workout that uses rest-pause and drop sets

rubric.uses_rest_pause: At least one exercise uses rest-pause technique
rubric.uses_drop_sets: At least one exercise uses drop sets
rubric.has_structure: Clear sets, techniques, and rest periods for each exercise

prompt: Design a deload week program after a heavy training block

rubric.reduced_volume: Volume is significantly reduced from normal training
rubric.maintains_movement: Still includes the main movement patterns
rubric.recovery_focused: Focus is on recovery and active rest

prompt: Create a glute-focused workout for building a stronger posterior chain

rubric.posterior_chain: Includes hamstrings and lower back support work
rubric.has_hip_thrust: Includes hip thrusts or glute bridges
rubric.volume_appropriate: Sufficient volume for glute development (12-20 sets)

prompt: Make a quick lunchtime workout I can do in 15 minutes at my office gym

rubric.practical: Can be done in a basic gym setting
rubric.efficient: Uses supersets or circuits for time efficiency

prompt: Build a conjugate method program with max effort and dynamic effort days

rubric.has_max_effort: Includes max effort day with heavy singles/triples
rubric.has_dynamic_effort: Includes dynamic effort day with speed work
rubric.has_accessories: Includes accessory work targeting weak points

prompt: Design a workout for a teenager just starting to lift weights

rubric.technique_emphasis: Emphasizes form and technique over heavy weight
rubric.safety_note: Mentions supervision or learning proper form

prompt: Create a strength and conditioning program for a basketball player

rubric.sport_specific: Includes exercises relevant to basketball (jumping, lateral movement, core)

prompt: Make a high-volume chest day with 25+ total sets

rubric.exercise_variety: Multiple angles and movement patterns (flat, incline, decline, fly)
rubric.has_structure: Clear sets, reps, and rest periods
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real chest exercises

prompt: Build a recovery day workout with foam rolling and light movement

rubric.has_foam_rolling: Includes foam rolling or self-myofascial release
rubric.light_movement: Includes light cardio or mobility work
rubric.not_intense: No heavy lifting or high-intensity work

prompt: Design a strongman training workout with carries, presses, and pulls

rubric.strongman_events: Includes strongman-style events (carries, stones, log press, etc.)
rubric.has_carries: Includes loaded carries (farmer's walk, yoke, etc.)
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real strongman movements

prompt: Create a program to improve my pull-up from 0 to 10 reps

rubric.progressive: Clear progression from assisted to unassisted
rubric.has_accessory: Includes supporting exercises (rows, bicep work, lat pulldowns)
rubric.has_frequency: Specifies how often to train pull-ups per week

prompt: Make an arm workout that alternates biceps and triceps supersets for 40 minutes

rubric.balanced: Equal attention to biceps and triceps
rubric.volume_appropriate: Appropriate number of sets for 40 minutes
rubric.no_hallucinated_exercises: All exercises are real arm exercises
